channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The pandemic has inflicted carnage in care homes across England, where 4343 residents died in just one fortnight.
item.title: Britain's true coronavirus death toll 40 per cent higher than official figures

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe downloads soar as global COVID-19 deaths surpass 210,000, Australian death toll stands at 85

item.description: US cases of the novel coronavirus have surpassed one million, having doubled in 18 days, and making up one-third of all infections in the world.
item.title: US coronavirus cases top one million as projected death toll rises

item.description: The owner of British Airways said it expected results to get worse in a statement also setting out plans for a sweeping restructuring at the airline.
item.title: British Airways warns up to 12,000 jobs will go due to coronavirus pandemic

item.description: Spectacular waves more than seven metres high barrelled on Tahiti's famed Teahupo'o reef recently. There was barely a surfer out in the water.
item.title: The coronavirus swell: Surf’s up, but everyone must stay at home

item.description: "We have a rare and short window of opportunity to rebuild our world for the better," UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said.
item.title: Use pandemic to 'rebuild our world for the better': UN chief

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 29, 2020

item.dc:creator: Dom Knight
item.description: The COVIDSafe app might just be the first privacy incursion that benefits us, instead of advertisers or the state.
item.title: I'm more worried about Mark Zuckerberg than this government and its tracing app

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Right now children are caught up in the middle of a massive power struggle between the important adults in their life.
item.title: There's a crucial voice missing in the debate about reopening schools

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: The criminal lawyer discovered recently he may have prostate cancer.
item.title: Convicted lawyer Michael Croke avoids jail for now over cancer scare

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Doubling unemployment benefits for struggling households during the pandemic has led to a groundswell of support for a permanent increase in dole payments.
item.title: 'Pretty heartless' to strip JobSeeker back, Lambie says as she calls for permanent rise

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Not every industry is doing it tough as the coronavirus pandemic takes its toll.
item.title: Pandemic a boom time for nation’s lobbyists

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, April 29

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: New Zealand-owned clothing retailer AS Colour will lease an 18,800 square metre distribution centre in Melbourne’s west.
item.title: Dexus signs up AS Colour for new distribution centre

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: The Dharawal people bring a unique perspective to Captain Cook's arrival in Botany Bay.
item.title: ‘We’re still here’: 250 years after Cook landing, Aboriginal community reflects

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: The boom in online shopping amid the coronavirus lockdown has underpinned demand for industrial property, with no easing expected over the medium term.
item.title: Industrial leases flying off the shelves

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Singapore's $340 billion sovereign wealth fund Temasek has emerged as a possible wildcard in the race for control of collapsed airline Virgin Australia.
item.title: Singapore Inc could stick with Virgin Australia through BGH bid

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Amid current conditions, low interest rates and reassessment of office demand has provided a solid foundation for Sydney's strata office sector.
item.title: Strata office sales are defying market conditions

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Leading university researchers have presented a "roadmap to recovery" to the government, with the experts divided over two possible paths.
item.title: Australian leaders given two strategies for rebounding from COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: As tensions threaten to erupt over the coronavirus outbreak, former BHP chief Chip Goodyear urges countries to set aside divisions and forge closer ties.
item.title: Ex-BHP chief Goodyear urges global ties as virus blame game sparks tension

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Sydney-based AVARI Capital Partners will refurbish a West Melbourne office after buying it for $38.5 million.
item.title: Developer trio sells off second heritage-listed building

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Scott Morrison has killed it when it comes to COVID-19, but that won't necessarily translate into gratitude from voters.
item.title: I wouldn't want to be in Scott Morrison's shoes

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: After 250 years, we're still not sure what to make of it.
item.title: Here's what Captain Cook's landing should be about

item.dc:creator: Chris Uhlmann
item.description: Of course we should trade with China but it has to be with our eyes wide open.
item.title: We can't return to business as usual with China

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Developer and landlord Growthpoint Properties has delayed some projects and will offer rent relief for its smaller tenants as it works through the longer-term impact of the coronavirus.
item.title: Growthpoint delays projects, offers rent relief for small tenants

item.description: Peter Hartcher succinctly elucidates why Australia needs to assert its independence of other nations.
item.title: Strength can be found on long road to independence

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Buyers are taking a longer-term view despite the coronavirus uncertainty.
item.title: Dish & Spoon Cafe premises sells for $1.38m

item.dc:creator: Lissa Christopher
item.description: Sick of the couch yet? Here are five easy but impactful life skills you can learn in no time.
item.title: Top five handy life skills to pick up in lockdown

item.description: 50 years ago, Sydney celebrated the bicentenary of Cook's landing with fireworks, Royal visitors and a re-enactment at Botany Bay.
item.title: From the Archives, 1970: The step that came 200 years ago

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Break in showbiz, casino for Sydney?, and Blue Mountains rescue.
item.title: In the Herald: April 29, 1979

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Ahmad al Daki was 12 when bombs began to fall on his doorstep in Syria. Now 20 and studying nursing in Sydney, he is eager to help.
item.title: Lockdown life from Syria to Sydney: aspiring nurse wants to help fight virus

item.description: Sixteen-year-old Daniel thought his great uncle was “just another uncle who came to Christmas.” It took a cancer diagnosis to uncover his story.
item.title: Don't wait for a crisis to dig up your family's history

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: John Silvester sits down with Mick Gatto in the first episode of The Age’s Naked City podcast – The Best Defence is Self-Defence. No subject was off limits.
item.title: The Gatto story: blow by blow

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Australia's first freight controller will make sure critical medical supplies can travel around the nation despite the loss of passenger flight cargo space.
item.title: Australia's first freight controller to guide critical supplies

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Almost a month after the federal government urged everyone to get vaccinated, hundreds of people remain on waiting lists and GPs are being forced to ration.
item.title: 'Crying on the phone': Flu shot shortage hits amid supply breakdown

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Australia's top researchers and science leaders have formed a group called the Rapid Research Information Forum to help government navigate the COVID-19 crisis.
item.title: Science strike force warns winter could help virus spread faster

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Despite China's objections, Taiwan argues they have much to teach the world about tackling coronavirus.
item.title: Taiwan pushes Australia to back World Health Organisation tilt

item.description: The beds will be sent to bolster state stockpiles and help overseas in Indonesia and the Pacific Islands.
item.title: Australian manufacturers making 1000 emergency hospital beds a week

item.description: I offered to play the board game with my daughter for 10 minutes, but by that time I was already through college and curious to see how my life would turn out.
item.title: Game of Life: Who knows where the time goes?

item.description: The finest photos from the wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Private schools will get a financial incentive to open up their classrooms before June in a federal plan to get kids back into school.
item.title: Federal payday gives NSW private schools reward to return to class

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Private schools will get a financial incentive to open up their classrooms before June in a federal plan to get kids back into school.
item.title: Federal payday gives private schools a reward to return to class

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Private hospitals given a $2.6 billion lifeline to help them survive the elective surgery ban could be forced to pay back funds if they breached it.
item.title: Private hospitals could be forced to hand back cash for elective surgeries

item.description: There is mounting pressure for the regulator to step in and police the buy now pay later sector as economic downturn bites.
item.title: Crunch time for BNPL sector as unemployment rises
